text: Ronald gee Wayne born May 17 1934 in the
midst of the Great Depression Jobs had
this focus once he got an idea in his
head that was it and you never wanted to
be between him and where he wanted to go
you'd wind up with footprints on your
forehead this is the contract that I
personally typed up he regarded me as
something of a minor mentor because I
was somewhat more diplomatic than he was
there was a problem he was having at
that time with Steve Wozniak I said
bring him over the house we'll sit down
we'll chat and it took me 45 minutes
certainly less than an hour to get him
to understand no you can't do it that
way for a business enterprise okay fine
he bought into it he understood and at
that moment in time Steve Jobs says we
are going to form a company
twelve days later I went down to the
registrar's office and have my name
taken off the contract
the company goes poof we are
individually liable for the debts of a
company well Jobs and Wozniak didn't
have two nickels to rub together
I had a house bank account and a car and
I was reachable some months later I get
this letter in the mail with a check for
$1,500 I believe it was $1,500 and the
letter says all you got to do is sign
away every possible interest you could
have in the Apple computer company and
the check is yours well I figured that I
had already done that as far as I was
concerned it was found money you know so
I went ahead and I signed I was
surprised to learn that Steve Jobs was
looking for a mentor I wouldn't have
thought him the type to be open to any
sort of constructive criticism from what
I read of him my green people must be
fascinated by Steve Jobs oh of course
and should be he was a fascinating man
who made Apple what it was obviously
Jobs's technique all right was Jobs a
nice guy in many ways no but that
doesn't matter that's not what we're
talking about we're talking about what
did it take to make Apple what it was I
think people will watch this hmm and
they'll say surely as Ron's about sir go
to sleep he must often think of what
could have been yeah I mean Apple I mean
deed I knew exactly what would have
verified a state with a company I would
have wound up heading a very large
documentation department at the back of
the building shuffling papers for the
next 20 years of my life and that was
not the future that I saw for myself and
find something that you enjoy doing so
much that you'd be willing to do it for
nothing and you'll never work a day in
your life
